text:
By mistake I passed -p option doubling it instead of passsing one -p option and
one -n option. ab2 segfaulted :

phosowicz@zzz:~$ /usr/sbin/ab2 -s -c 100 -p 200 -p file.post 
https://www.xxx.pl/app/some-script
Invalid postfile name (200): No such file or directory
This is ApacheBench, Version 2.0.41-dev <$Revision: 1.141 $> apache-2.0
Copyright (c) 1996 Adam Twiss, Zeus Technology Ltd, http://www.zeustech.net/
Copyright (c) 1998-2002 The Apache Software Foundation, http://www.apache.org/

Benchmarking www.xxx.pl (be patient)...Naruszenie ochrony pamięci

Naruszenie ochrony pamięci = Violation of memory protection

... in other words SEGV, here is the end of strace :

...
--- SIGSEGV (Segmentation fault) @ 0 (0) ---
+++ killed by SIGSEGV +++

Version (it's Debian 3.1) :

phosowicz@zzz:~$ dpkg -l apache2-utils
...
ii  apache2-utils      2.0.55-4           utility programs for webservers

I repeated the test with :

-c 1 -p 1 -p file.post
-c 2 -p 1 -p file.post
-c 2 -p 2 -p file.post
-c 2 -p 200 -p file.post

.. and it didn't SEGV (!). Maybe it's a random thing, maybe not. If you need I
can send here a full strace.

Regards,

Piotr Hosowicz
creator: phosowicz@ecard.pl
phosowicz@ecard.pl
text:
I forgot to write it explicitly in the previous message : same SEGV occurs with
ab, as with ab2 .

This invocation lacks an "-n" parameter which is greater in value than the "-c"
parameter - in 2.2.x ab gives a suitable error message for such usage, rather
than segfaulting.

$ ./support/ab -c 200 http://localhost/
./support/ab: Cannot use concurrency level greater than total number of requests
creator: jorton@redhat.com
